str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pas and a derivative of rheo; all out-spokenness, i.e. Frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From kata and lambano; to take eagerly, i.e. Seize, possess, etc.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Unlettered, i.e. Illiterate.
From idios; a private person, i.e. an ignoramus.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
